title: The Application Class Quiz

quizContent.question: What is the JAX-RS class that you need to extend in order to configure your REST application?

answers.content: Servlets are slow in execution performance
Servlet technology is outdated, and it's better to use the newer Application class
The servlet approach restricts you to a servlet container. The Application class is deployment-agnostic.

quizContent.question: Why would we prefer to use the Application class instead of a servlet class to bootstrap a JAX-RS application?

answers.content: Create a class with the name Application and make it available in the class path
Create a sub-class of the abstract Application class and make it available in the class path
Create an implementation of the Application interface and implement all the methods of the interface
Annotate your resource classes with the @Application annotation

quizContent.question: How do you configure your JAX-RS application using the Application class?
